fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.processors.interfaces

Interface ProcessorStateDataConsumerI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Computer, ProcessorMonitor

    public interface ProcessorStateDataConsumerI
    The interface ProcessorStateDataConsumerI defines the consumer side methods used to receive state data pushed by a processor, both static and dynamic.

    Description

    The interface must be implemented by all classes representing components that will consume as clients state data pushed by a processor. They are used by ProcessorStaticStateOutboundPort and ProcessorDynamicicStateOutboundPort to pass these data upon reception from the processor component. As a client component may receive data from several different processors, it can assign URI to each at the creation of outbound ports, so that these can pass these URI when receiving data. Hence, the methods defined in this interface will be unique in one client component but receive the data pushed by all of the different processors.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : April 8, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
